items.sentence: Tom hasn\'t yet been punished for doing that.
Tom hasn\'t yet read that book, but Mary has.
Let\'s hope Tom hasn\'t done anything stupid.
I crossed the room and looked out the window.
Tom didn\'t tell Mary he was going to Boston.
Tom has gotten accustomed to it working here.
Tom has learned a lot about Boston from Mary.
Tom wouldn\'t tell me his girlfriend\'s name.
Tom wouldn\'t tell me why he didn\'t do that.
Would you please tell me what you see in him?
Would you put this in the safety deposit box?
Tom said he needed a special tool to do that.
Tom told me that he likes this kind of music.
I wonder why so many of these nails are bent.
You\'re much taller than Tom is, aren\'t you?
You\'re named after your father, aren\'t you?
I suspect Tom isn\'t likely to do that today.
I suspect Tom won\'t need to do that anymore.
I suspect Tom won\'t wait until we get there.
I suspect Tom won\'t want to dance with Mary.
